# Introduction

## Workshop Goals

This workshop is not exhaustive but meant to be a first contact with the R programming language. We hope you leave the workshop able to say:

> R isn't scary!

We also hope to show you you can use R to do things with data you're already familiar with, as well as clinical computations.

## Object Types

Data Frames in R are like Datasets in SAS®

Data frames are made up of columns called "vectors" – treated like Variables in SAS®



More data types exist, but we'll focus on data frames
Basic variable types:

- Character (`"A"`)
- Numeric (`100`)
- Boolean (`TRUE`)

## Operators in R

| Operator | Meaning | Example | 
| --- | --- | --- |
| == | equal to | `x == y` | 
| != | not equal to | `x != y` |
| < | less than | `x < y` | 
| <= | less than or equal to | `x <= y` |
| > | greater than | `x > y` |
| >= | greater than or equal to | `x >= y` |
| `|` | or | `x | y` |
| & | and | `x & y` |
| ! | not | `!x` |
